results.title: Turning point: rescue of a river
results.brief_description: History of citizen action for the protection of the Wilamet River in Oregon, U.S.A., and the current program - Project Foresight - for the preservation of open space and the limiting of urban sprawl so that both the Wilamet Valley and the Wilamet River remain free of cumulating industrial wastes and continue to be agriculturally fertile and productive
results.description: History of citizen action for the protection of the Wilamet River in Oregon, U.S.A., and the current program - Project Foresight - for the preservation of open space and the limiting of urban sprawl so that both the Wilamet Valley and the Wilamet River remain free of cumulating industrial wastes and continue to be agriculturally fertile and productive

results.title: Turning point
results.brief_description: 1970 and world population below the age of fifteen has almost reached 1500 million. Of these, only one out of four gets any primary education, and less than one out of twelve achieves secondary schooling. What can be done to bridge the gap of ignorance, and prevent more millions from joining the ranks of the uneducated? Made for International Education Year.

results.title: Turning perceptions
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Karlene Lynch and ACMI
results.brief_description: Karlene Lynch found out when she was 21 that she had Turner’s Syndrome. Despite the agony of being infertile and the health difficulties, Lynch has led a happy and inspiring life.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Karlene Lynch and ACMI

results.title: Turning a sphere inside out (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: David Nelson, William Hansard and Educational Development Center
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Geometry”
Uses advanced computer animation to discuss the problem of turning a sphere inside out by passing the surface through itself without making any holes or creases. Illustrates the homotopy with a sequence of models, showing the crucial stages in the motion.

results.title: Turning 18
results.creator_credit: Video Projects, Open Channel Productions, Penny Robins, Peter Kaufman and Tony Wright
results.brief_description: An amusing look at some serious issues that are related to turning eighteen - the age by which a person is legally recognised as an adult in this society. This program, subtitled, “Almost 20 Minutes” is a parody of the current affairs television program, “60 Minutes”.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Video Projects, Open Channel Productions, Penny Robins, Peter Kaufman and Tony Wright

results.title: Turning
results.brief_description: Looks at Anatolia and its part in the evolution of Caucasian civilization, in particular that of modern Middle Eastern religious thought. The Dervishes and their ancient dance rituals are studied in some detail.

results.title: Turner's Syndrome : trials and triumphs
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Jackie Breasley and ACMI
results.brief_description: Living with Turner’s Syndrome, Jackie Breasley has had to overcome many difficulties. As she grows up, she has faced much more heartbreaking challenges. Regardless, these challenges all present Breasley with opportunities to triumph.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Jackie Breasley and ACMI

results.title: Turned round to see
results.creator_credit: Karl Holtsnider, Franciscan Communications Center and Nicholas Frangakis
results.brief_description: A dramatisation about the experiences of a lonely and puzzled 17-year-old boy who wanders into a teenage discotheque. Expresses the need for self knowledge and that such self knowledge leads an individual to reach out to others.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Karl Holtsnider, Franciscan Communications Center and Nicholas Frangakis
